label: 御禊
本: The Clear Mirror:  A Chronicle of Japanese Court During the Kamakura Period, (1185-1333) . Stanford University Press . 1998
説明文: A preliminary to the great thanksgiving festival; usually performed at the Kamo River, to which the emperor traveled in a magnificent procession.The most prominent figure in the imperial retinue was the acting consort" (nyōgodai), a girl or young woman especially chosen for the occasion. McCullough and McCullough 1980: 139, 376. [女御代　加茂川] "
